summary: This is an email chain from July 24, 2019, between U.S. Attorney's Office personnel discussing scheduling a meeting. The primary subject is the receipt of subpoena results from an entity (El) regarding Epstein materials, with a note that the entity is not considered a subject or target and has been responsive. The emails coordinate a time for the parties to discuss an investigation that overlaps with the Epstein case.

persons.name: Swett, Sebastian
persons.context: Addressed in emails regarding scheduling a meeting to discuss subpoena results and an investigation overlapping with Epstein matters.

persons.name: Maurene Comey
persons.context: Sent the initial email requesting a meeting to discuss an investigation into an entity that overlaps with Epstein matters, noting they have received subpoena results.

connections.description: Communicating via email to schedule a meeting regarding an investigation and subpoena results related to Epstein.

events.title: Email coordination for Epstein-related meeting
events.description: Assistant U.S. Attorney Maurene Comey emails colleagues to schedule a meeting to discuss subpoena results received from an entity regarding Epstein materials and an overlapping investigation.

locations: U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York, 1 St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York received subpoena results from an entity (referenced as 'El') regarding Epstein materials.
The entity that provided the subpoena results is not considered a subject or target in connection with their work with Epstein.
The entity has been described as 'very responsive' to the subpoena requests.
There is an ongoing investigation that overlaps with the Epstein case, prompting a meeting discussion among prosecutors.
